title: Canada Post mail delivery slowed, stopped in parts of B.C. due to snow
text:
BC Canada Post mail delivery slowed, stopped in parts of B.C. due to snow Unsafe conditions mean no Canada Post delivery in Kootenay Pass area and slowed delivery in the Vancouver area CBC News Posted: Feb 06, 2017 1:15 PM PT Last Updated: Feb 06, 2017 1:15 PM PT Heavy snow and dangerous conditions have stopped Canada Post mail delivery in parts of the Kootenays. Here, a car parked on Ward Street in Nelson's downtown is almost completely buried by snow. (Bob Keating/CBC) Related Stories Here we go again: Metro Vancouver prepares for another wintry week 
Heavy snowfall has slowed Canada Post's mail delivery in the Vancouver area and stopped it altogether in the Kootenay Pass region of B.C., according to a service alert. 
In the Lower Mainland, including Metro Vancouver, Abbotsford and Chilliwack, Canada Post warned that some customers will not receive mail today, as carriers are impeded by "severe weather conditions and heavy snowfall." 
Mail is not being delivered at all in many parts of the Kootenays , including Grand Forks, Creston, Castlegar, Cranbrook, Fernie and Sparwood, said Canada Post.
